Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder are riding a franchise-record 14-game winning streak while facing the reigning champion Celtics.
The Celtics are on a three-game winning streak, shooting 51.6% from the floor with a 133.6 offensive rating and 103.3 defensive rating.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is averaging 32.7 points, 5.2 assists, 5.2 rebounds, 2.3 steals, and 1.2 blocks during the streak.
Kristaps Porzingis mentioned the challenge of facing Gilgeous-Alexander and highlighted the team's need for improvement.
The Thunder have shown resilience, trailing by at least 12 points in their last three wins, including a 14-point deficit against the Knicks.
The Thunder are facing a four-game stretch against the top three Eastern Conference teams, with a 10-0 record against them.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder have a strong defensive record with a 102.9 defensive rating.
The Celtics have been focused on reconnecting to their identity on both ends of the floor.
